Sentencas: A composite Ni-perovskite anode was investigated for operation in dry propane-fed intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFC).
Titulo: Electrochemical investigation of a propane-fed solid oxide fuel cell based on a composite Ni-perovskite anode catalyst

Sentencas: A La0.6Sr0.4Fe0.8Co0.2O3 (LSFCO) perovskite, characterized by mixed electronic-ionic conductivity, was used to support a highly dispersed Ni-phase.
Titulo: Electrochemical investigation of a propane-fed solid oxide fuel cell based on a composite Ni-perovskite anode catalyst

Sentencas: However, the catalyst structure was modified during SOFC operation.
Titulo: Electrochemical investigation of a propane-fed solid oxide fuel cell based on a composite Ni-perovskite anode catalyst

Sentencas: X-ray diffraction analysis of the electrocatalyst showed that, after operation, Ni was mainly present as La2NiO4; whereas, the LSFCO structure was partially modified into a lanthanum-depleted SrFe1-xCoxO3-y (SFCO) perovskite structure.
Titulo: Electrochemical investigation of a propane-fed solid oxide fuel cell based on a composite Ni-perovskite anode catalyst

Sentencas: These results were corroborated by X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS).
Titulo: Electrochemical investigation of a propane-fed solid oxide fuel cell based on a composite Ni-perovskite anode catalyst

Sentencas: Transmission electron microscopy (TEM) analysis showed the presence of a suitable dispersion of a narrosized Ni-phase and a strong interaction of Ni-enriched particles with the perovskite substrate.
Titulo: Electrochemical investigation of a propane-fed solid oxide fuel cell based on a composite Ni-perovskite anode catalyst

Sentencas: High reaction rates for the propane reaction were achieved with this electrocatalyst while minimizing carbon deposition.
Titulo: Electrochemical investigation of a propane-fed solid oxide fuel cell based on a composite Ni-perovskite anode catalyst

Sentencas: Power densities of about 300 MW cm(-2) for dry propane oxidation were obtained at 800 degrees C in the presence of a thick gadolinia-doped ceria electrolyte.
Titulo: Electrochemical investigation of a propane-fed solid oxide fuel cell based on a composite Ni-perovskite anode catalyst

Sentencas: Fuel cell time-tests indicated promising electrochemical stability.
Titulo: Electrochemical investigation of a propane-fed solid oxide fuel cell based on a composite Ni-perovskite anode catalyst
